intro: Solanum malacothrix, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by berries that turn from green to red as they mature. Its leaves are covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Solanum malacothrix belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
